intro: Epipactis flaminia, commonly known as the Flaminian helleborine, is a species of orchid native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is a terrestrial herb with a dense, dark green foliage that often forms a rosette. The plant produces showy, greenish-yellow flowers with a distinctive lip that is usually darker in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and along stream banks. Epipactis flaminia is known for its ability to hybridize with other epipactis species, contributing to its genetic diversity.
